title: minimal?
description: Write a function `minimal?` that takes a binary search tree and returns true if the tree is minimal (no node has a left child), and false otherwise.

examples.explanation: A single node tree is minimal

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (minimal? t))

(minimal? empty)
(minimal? (make-node empty empty 5))
(minimal? (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
(minimal? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) empty 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (minimal? (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15) 10)) true)
(check-expect (minimal? (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) false)
(check-expect (minimal? (make-node empty (make-node empty (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) 16) 15)) false)
